channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Sabina Nessa: Murder arrest as police issue CCTV appeal
item.description: A 38-year-old is arrested in Lewisham as police release a CCTV image of a man they are searching for.

item.title: Annabel Wright: Family 'made aware' of Roaccutane adverse effects
item.description: Annabel Wright, 15, had been using Roaccutane in the months before she died, an inquest hears.

item.title: Cheshire man confessed to helpline that he strangled neighbour
item.description: David Mottram killed Samantha Heap after telling her he was locked out of his flat, a court hears.

item.title: Bolton Wanderers FC cuts betting links at stadium
item.description: The League One club says it will not promote betting or sign any new deals with gambling firms.

item.title: Sheffield scientist sent indecent image to undercover officers
item.description: Paul Bower sent an indecent photo of himself to officers posing online as two 13-year-old girls.

item.title: Smethwick supermarket fined over mice and unsafe shelving
item.description: The store in Smethwick is fined more than £500,000 over hygiene problems and dangerous shelving.

item.title: Hidden model railway collection fetches £21k
item.description: Adrian Batty's wife says she had no idea her late husband had amassed hundreds of rare models.

item.title: Magic Circle: First female president says role 'is an honour'
item.description: Aged 28, Megan Swann is also the youngest person to lead the 116-year-old society.

item.title: Woman with Down's loses abortion law fight
item.description: Heidi Crowter says the current law on abortion for foetuses with the condition does not respect her life.

item.title: Fleetwood Town owner faces fraud and money-laundering charges
item.description: Fleetwood Town chairman Andrew Pilley is charged with fraudulently mis-selling energy supplies.

item.title: Covid-19: Southport respite centre 'may have to shut' over vaccine rule
item.description: Respite centre staff are threatening to quit over the issue of compulsory vaccines, a charity says.

item.title: Harwich trial: Men 'smuggled 69 people in UK in fishing trawler'
item.description: Prosecutors allege using such a vessel is "uncommon and more sophisticated" than lorries.

item.title: Refugee councillor wants warm welcome for Afghans
item.description: Vijay Manro, whose family fled Idi Amin's terror in Uganda, wants Afghans to get a similar welcome.

item.title: Stonehenge autumn equinox gathering first since start of pandemic
item.description: About 250 people gathered at the stones to watch the sunrise on the first day of autumn.

item.title: Deputy head teacher in sex offender 'friendship' banned
item.description: The teacher admitted allowing her friend to use her school laptop.

item.title: Seal pictured off south Devon with crab pot entangled around neck
item.description: Efforts are under way to try to rescue the entangled seal off south Devon.

item.title: Killamarsh: Father's tribute to daughter killed at sleepover
item.description: Connie Gent was one of three children who were killed at a Derbyshire home.

item.title: Knightsbridge killing: Man who murdered student near Harrods jailed
item.description: Badir Al-Nazi is sentenced to a minimum of 27 years in prison for killing Mohammed Al-Araimi.

item.title: Northampton cannabis burglary killing: Four found guilty
item.description: The victim's family say he was "naïve to the risks of the very dark underworld" of drug cultivation.

item.title: Six arrested on explosive charges in Dewsbury takeaway raid
item.description: Five men and a woman are arrested on suspicion of making or possessing explosives.

item.title: Ric Pallister: former council leader guilty of indecent assaults
item.description: Ric Pallister, ex-leader of of South Somerset District Council, has been found guilty of 18 charges.

item.title: 'Severe' blaze at Birmingham warehouse tackled
item.description: Roads will remain closed after the 'severe' fire in Highgate, Birmingham.

item.title: Cornwall homeless to be housed in holiday parks
item.description: Housing is "the greatest priority" facing Cornwall Council, a meeting hears.

item.title: Social prescribing: How a community garden helps combat isolation
item.description: Sara Lee says she has "come out of her shell" after being referred to Blackpool Community Farm.

item.title: The Cumbrian walking group going strong after 20 years
item.description: The weekly group in Cumbria was set up in 1998 for former bank colleagues to stay in contact.

item.title: Teenager in Peterborough e-scooter near-miss with bus
item.description: The 16-year-old is sentenced after CCTV sees him almost colliding with the vehicle in Peterborough.

item.title: Virtual reality helps Stafford cancer patients
item.description: From Phuket to the Peak District - cancer patients visit sun-kissed beaches without leaving hospice.

item.title: School helps buy treadmill so Newmarket boy can walk
item.description: Doctors feared Bryson, aged nine, might never walk or talk after being born premature.

item.title: Extra £1m for Plymouth shootings community
item.description: Plymouth MP Luke Pollard says he has been receiving mental health support following the shootings.

item.title: Channel crossings: September sees record number of migrants
item.description: UK authorities intercepted almost 3,900 migrants this month, more than the previous record in July.

item.title: Gemma Sisley: Brother mortified by 2008 killer's open jail move
item.description: Gemma Sisley was strangled to death by Jason Burrows after she ended their relationship.

item.title: Pig farmers say butcher shortage could lead to cull of animals
item.description: A Gloucestershire pig farmer says they are feeling "desperate" as the number of animals builds up.

item.title: Victorian ticket ledger found at March railway station
item.description: The luggage ledger dates back to April 1885, when the railway station opened.

item.title: England v New Zealand: Heather Knight inspires hosts to ODI series victory
item.description: Heather Knight leads England to their highest successful run chase in a ODI as they beat New Zealand by three wickets to clinch the five-match series.

item.title: County Championship: Dramatic Lancashire victory ends Hampshire title hopes
item.description: Lancashire will become champions if Warwickshire fail to beat Somerset after a one-wicket win over Hampshire at Aigburth.

item.title: Super League: Wigan Warriors 0-8 Leeds Rhinos
item.description: Leeds book their place in the Super League play-off semi-finals after edging past Wigan Warriors in their eliminator.

item.title: Derby County: Wayne Rooney vows to stay despite club going into administration
item.description: Wayne Rooney reiterates he will not quit Derby County despite the club being placed in administration.

item.title: Anthony Joshua: 'I'd fight King Kong if I had to' says champion as he prepares to face Usyk
item.description: Anthony Joshua says he'd 'fight King Kong' as he prepares to take on Oleksandr Usyk at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.
